intro: Dryas tschonoskii, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features dense clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically hairy and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. Dryas tschonoskii thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often found at high elevations where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
